newsitem.title: USA: Consumers 780 MW nuke seen in startup Tues.
newsitem.headline: Consumers 780 MW nuke seen in startup Tues.

text.p: Consumers Energy's 780 megawatt Palisades nuclear power plant in South Haven, Mich., was expected to begin electricity production Tuesday after a shutdown for repairs, a company spokesman said.
"The reactor is critical and we expect to synchronize to the (electricity) grid sometime this morning," spokesman Mark Savage said Tuesday.
The unit is expected to go through several days of restart testing as it ramps up to full power, the Savage said.
Palisades was shut during a restart mode January 6 after the discovery of leaks in main steam isolation valves.
The unit was originally shut January 5 for electrical repairs.
Palisades produces 18 percent of Consumers Energy's total electrical output.
Consumers Energy is a subsidiary of CMS Energy Corp.
